extendedIngredients.name: curry powder
extendedIngredients.original: 1 Tbsp curry powder, preferably Madras (see Note)

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 lbs shrimp, (30-40 per lb), peeled and deveined
extendedIngredients.originalName: shrimp, (30-40 per lb), peeled and deveined

title: Curry-roasted Shrimp With Oranges
summary: Curry-roasted Shrimp With Oranges is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe with 25 servings. One portion of this dish contains roughly 6g of protein, 1g of fat, and a total of 38 calories. For 59 cents per serving, this recipe covers 3% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 18 people have tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 42 minutes. Head to the store and pick up curry powder, kosher salt, oranges, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 34%. This score is not so excellent. Try Curry-Roasted Shrimp with Chutney and Yogurt, Roasted Tomato Curry Soup with Shrimp, and Roasted Curry Shrimp & Zucchini Sheet Pan Meal for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Anne Amie Pinot Gris. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 14 dollars.

productMatches.title: Anne Amie Pinot Gris
productMatches.description:
Aromas of Bartlett pear, gardenia, white peach, white tea, jasmine, graham cracker, and straw. Flavors of Asian pear, white fig, white peach, white strawberry, and fennel flowers. The finish is dry, long and acid driven.
Pairs well with roast chicken, Caesar salad, mussels, quince glazed pork chop, grilled squash, pan seared trout, and bibimbap.

instructions: Preheat oven to 400F. Line a baking sheet (with sides) with parchment paper. Finely grate the zest of 1 orange; set aside. Using a sharp knife, peel both oranges, removing all the bitter white pith. Thinly slice the oranges crosswise, then cut the slices into quarters. Spread the orange slices on the prepared baking sheet and sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Roast until the oranges are slightly dry, about 12 minutes.Meanwhile, toss shrimp with oil, curry powder, pepper, the orange zest and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a large bowl. Transfer the shrimp to the baking sheet with the oranges and roast until pink and curled, about 6 minutes. Divide the oranges and the shrimp among 4 plates and serve.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400F. Line a baking sheet (with sides) with parchment paper. Finely grate the zest of 1 orange; set aside. Using a sharp knife, peel both oranges, removing all the bitter white pith. Thinly slice the oranges crosswise, then cut the slices into quarters.

Spread the orange slices on the prepared baking sheet and sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Roast until the oranges are slightly dry, about 12 minutes.Meanwhile, toss shrimp with oil, curry powder, pepper, the orange zest and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a large bowl.
Transfer the shrimp to the baking sheet with the oranges and roast until pink and curled, about 6 minutes. Divide the oranges and the shrimp among 4 plates and serve.
